page.title: 01Chatteris - Gazetteer
page.content:
This fen area is on the outskirts of Chatteris, a small market town with a population of about 6,000 people. The land is used mainly for intense arable farming, (carrots, barley, sugar beet, potatoes) with the odd meadow left for grazing. Except for the west of the area which has a small private and council estate, the district is very sparsely populated with only the odd farmhouse or labourer's cottage, (now often occupied by "newcomers.") Two main waterways, the Forty and Sixteeen Foot drains cross the area which is also covered with a network of droves or tracks leading to farms.
Farming - arable, meadowland. Housing - private estate, council houses, farmhouses, cottages.
